context: The word 'asjus' is the inessive case (locative case indicating location within something) of the Estonian noun 'asi', which means 'matter', 'thing', or 'affair'. In this form, it functions as a prepositional phrase meaning 'about', 'in regard to', or 'concerning' when used at the beginning of a sentence. It indicates that the following content is related to the matter being discussed.
